net.sf.mmm.search.engine.base

Class SearchHitImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableObject
      • net.sf.mmm.search.base.AbstractSearchEntry
        • net.sf.mmm.search.engine.base.SearchHitImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SearchEntry, SearchHit, AttributeReadId<Long>

    public class SearchHitImpl
extends AbstractSearchEntry
implements SearchHit
    This is the abstract base implementation of the SearchHit interface.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

        entryId - is the entry-ID.
        hitScore - is the score of the hit.
        searchHighlighter - is the highlighter used for highlighting.

    • Method Detail

      • getScore

        public double getScore()
        This method gets the score of this hit. It is a positive value in the range from 0 to 1, where 1 represents a perfect hit and 0 represents a hit that has nothing in common with the search query. A hit will typically NOT have a score of 0 but the score may be close to 0.
        Specified by:
        getScore in interface SearchHit
        Returns:
        the score of this hit.

      • getScore

        public int getScore(int maximum)
        This method gets the score of this hit as an integer value in the range from 0 to maximum. The higher the score the better the hit. This method is useful to view the score as a percentage value (with a maximum of 100) or a number of stars (e.g. with a maximum of 5).
        Specified by:
        getScore in interface SearchHit
        Parameters:
        maximum - is the maximum score
        Returns:
        the score of this hit.
        See Also:
        SearchHit.getScore()

      • getHighlightedText

        public String getHighlightedText()
        This method gets an excerpt of the plain text of the content that contains terms of the search query as a highlighted html fragment.
        The highlighted terms should be surrounded by SearchHit.HIGHLIGHT_START_TAG and SearchHit.HIGHLIGHT_END_TAG and parts of the text that have been cut out should be replaced with SearchHit.HIGHLIGHT_CUT_TEXT. An implementing search-engine component may allow to override these defaults for custom needs.
        Specified by:
        getHighlightedText in interface SearchHit
        Returns:
        the highlighted text of this hit.
        See Also:
        SearchEntry.getText()

      • getEntryId

        public String getEntryId()
        This method gets the ID of this hit in the search index. It can be used to retrieve the entry again. It is explicitly unspecified and may vary in implementations if this is the same as SearchEntry.getId().
        Specified by:
        getEntryId in interface SearchHit
        Returns:
        the ID of this hit.

      • getFieldAsString

        public String getFieldAsString(String name)
        This method is a shortcut for getField(name, String.class).
        Specified by:
        getFieldAsString in interface SearchEntry
        Overrides:
        getFieldAsString in class AbstractSearchEntry
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the requested field.
        Returns:
        the value of the requested field or null if no field exists for the given name.

      • getField

        public Object getField(String name)
        This method is a generic accessor for fields of this entry. For the predefine fields (see FIELD_* constants like SearchEntry.FIELD_TEXT) there are specific getter methods like SearchEntry.getText().
        Specified by:
        getField in interface SearchEntry
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the requested field.
        Returns:
        the value of the field in its original type.
        See Also:
        SearchEntry.getField(String, Class)

      • getField

        public <T> T getField(String name,
                      Class<T> type)
        This method is a generic accessor for fields of this entry with a specific type.
        The type String will always work. Other types have to be compatible to the field type (or a RuntimeException will be thrown).
        Specified by:
        getField in interface SearchEntry
        Type Parameters:
        T - is the generic type expected for the requested field-value (see parameter type).
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the requested field.
        type - is the type of the requested field.
        Returns:
        the value of the requested field or null if no field exists for the given name.

      • getFieldNames

        public Iterator<String> getFieldNames()
        This method gets the names of all fields that are defined (NOT null).
        Specified by:
        getFieldNames in interface SearchEntry
        Returns:
        a read-only iterator of the field names.
